data.enText: intention
something that you intend to do or achieve

data.chText: 这个夏天你有什么打算？
data.enText: Do you have any plans for the summer?

data.chText: 现在没有建新办公楼的计划。
data.enText: There are no plans to build new offices.
Your best plan (= the best thing to do) would be to go by car.
There's been a change of plan .

data.chText: 我们现在不能改变计划了。
data.enText: We can't change our plans now.
arrangement
a set of things to do in order to achieve sth, especially one that has been considered in detail in advance

data.chText: 双方都同意维护和平的详细方案。
data.enText: Both sides agreed to a detailed plan for keeping the peace.

data.chText: 政府已经宣布开设一百万个新培训名额的计划。
data.enText: The government has announced plans to create one million new training places.

data.chText: 发展计划、营业规划、和平规划等
data.enText: a development/business/peace, etc. plan
a five-point plan
a three-year plan
We need to make plans for the future.
a plan of action/campaign

data.chText: 但愿一切都会按计划进行。
data.enText: Let's hope everything will go according to plan .
map
a detailed map of a building, town, etc.
a plan of the museum
a street plan of the city
drawing

data.chText: （机器、建筑等的）设计图，平面图；图解
data.enText: a detailed drawing of a machine, building, etc. that shows its size, shape and measurements

data.chText: 建筑师正在绘制新办公楼的设计图。
data.enText: The architect is drawing up plans for the new offices.
a diagram that shows how sth will be arranged
a seating plan (= showing where each person will sit, for example at a dinner)
a floor plan (= showing how furniture is arranged)
money
a way of investing money for the future
a savings plan
make arrangements
to make detailed arrangements for sth you want to do in the future
to plan a trip

data.chText: 会议计划明年年初召开。
data.enText: A meeting has been planned for early next year.

data.chText: 一切都严格地按计划进行。
data.enText: Everything went exactly as planned .

data.chText: 我们极为详细地安排了这一天的日程。
data.enText: We planned the day down to the last detail.
to plan for the future

data.chText: 我一直在筹划怎样度过这一天。
data.enText: I've been planning how I'm going to spend the day.

data.chText: 他们计划让两条路接上。
data.enText: They planned that the two routes would connect.
intend/expect
to intend or expect to do sth
We hadn't planned on going anywhere this evening.

data.chText: 他们预计在三点钟以后到达。
data.enText: They plan to arrive some time after three.

data.chText: 我们打算春天去法国旅游。你有意去吗？
data.enText: We're planning a trip to France in the spring─are you interested?
design
to make a design or an outline for sth

data.chText: 构思一篇文章；设计一个花园
data.enText: to plan an essay/a garden

data.chText: 一场精心策划的宣传活动
data.enText: a well-planned campaign
plan sth↔out
to plan carefully and in detail sth that you are going to do in the future

data.chText: 出发前要仔细设计你的路线。
data.enText: Plan out your route before you go.

data.chText: 她对自己的前途事业已作了精心规划。
data.enText: She has her career all planned out.

data.text: purpose ♦ aim ♦ intention ♦ plan ♦ point ♦ idea

data.chText: 以上各词均指意图、目的、目标。
data.enText: These are all words for talking about what sb/sth intends to do or achieve.
purpose
what sth is supposed to achieve; what sb is trying to achieve

data.chText: 我们这次活动的主要目的是募款。
data.enText: Our campaign's main purpose is to raise money.
aim
what sb is trying to achieve; what sth is supposed to achieve

data.chText: 她去伦敦是为了找工作。
data.enText: She went to London with the aim of finding a job.

data.chText: 我们的主要目标是增加在欧洲的销售量。
data.enText: Our main aim is to increase sales in Europe.

data.chText: purpose指做某事的原因，aim指要达到的目的。aim可以指尝试达到目的，purpose含有要成就某事的强烈感觉。aim可指某人的目的（sb's aim），也可指某事的目的（the aim of sth），purpose更常指做某事的原因（the purpose of sth），也可指某人的目的（sb's purpose），但这样用较正式。
data.enText: Your purpose for doing something is your reason for doing it; your aim is what you want to achieve. Aim can suggest that you are only trying to achieve sth; purpose gives a stronger sense of achievement being certain. Aim can be sb's aim or the aim of sth . Purpose is more usually the purpose of sth : you can talk about sb's purpose but that is more formal.
purpose or aim?
intention
what you intend to do
I have no intention of going to the wedding.

data.chText: 她虽然处处出于善意，却很少产生效果。
data.enText: She's full of good intentions but they rarely work out.
plan
what you intend to do or achieve

data.chText: 现在没有建新办公楼的计划。
data.enText: There are no plans to build new offices.

data.chText: intention尤指近期的打算、意图；plan通常但不总是指较长远的计划、安排。
data.enText: Your intentions are what you want to do, especially in the near future; your plans are what you have decided or arranged to do, often, but not always, in the longer term.
intention or plan?
point
( rather informal ) the purpose or aim of sth
What's the point of all this violence?

data.chText: 本课的目的是比较这两个国家。
data.enText: The point of the lesson is to compare the two countries.
idea
( rather informal ) the purpose of sth; sb's aim

data.chText: 我们去的唯一目的就是要见她的新男朋友。
data.enText: The whole idea of going was so that we could meet her new boyfriend.
What's the idea behind this?

data.chText: point比idea有更多的否定含义：what's the point ...?暗指毫无意义；what's the idea ...?用于真正询问目的。用point而非idea表示对所谈论的事情感到不快：
data.enText: Point is a more negative word than idea. If you say What's the point…? you are suggesting that there is no point; if you say What's the idea…? you are genuinely asking a question. Point , but not idea , is used to talk about things you feel annoyed or unhappy about.
There's no idea in…
I don't see the idea of…
point or idea?
with the purpose/aim/intention/idea of doing sth
sb's intention/plan to do sth
a(n) ambitious/realistic aim/plan
to have a(n) purpose/aim/intention/plan/point
to achieve/fulfil a(n) purpose/aim

ex.enText: Where do you plan to spend your holiday?

ex.chText: 数月来，我们一直在筹划我们的加拿大之行。
ex.enText: We have been planning our trip to Canada for months.

ex.chText: 警方正在调查他何时开始计划逃跑以及他的同谋有谁。
ex.enText: The police are investigating when he began planning his escape and who his accomplices were.

ex.chText: 他不是蓄意隐瞒真相的，只是一时害怕。
ex.enText: He didn't plan to conceal the truth. He was just too scared at that moment.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指事前仔细筹划、安排。

ex.enText: They had plotted to rob the bank.

ex.chText: 为什么军方密谋推翻他？
ex.enText: Why did the military secretly plot against him?
He plotted to overthrow the government.

synonyms.bx: 通常指秘密策划违法行为或针对某政要、政府的阴谋活动。

ex.chText: 学生们想要更多的时间来准备考试。
ex.enText: The students wanted more time to prepare their exams.

ex.chText: 他们正忙着准备去度蜜月。
ex.enText: They were busy preparing for their honeymoon.

synonyms.bx: 指为将要发生的事情作好计划、安排等。

ex.chText: 会议定于下星期五召开。
ex.enText: The conference is scheduled for next Friday.

ex.chText: 他的第一本书定于10月出版。
ex.enText: His first book is scheduled for publication in October.

synonyms.bx: 指将某事安排在某一时间或日期进行，通常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 邪恶的皇后密谋毒死小公主。
ex.enText: The evil queen schemed to kill the little princess with poison.

ex.chText: 他总是觉得他的同事们都在算计他。
ex.enText: He always feels that all his colleagues are scheming against him.

synonyms.bx: 指为牟取私利而投机取巧或搞阴谋。

data.enText: plan sth↔out
to plan carefully and in detail sth that you are going to do in the future

data.chText: 出发前要仔细设计你的路线。
data.enText: Plan out your route before you go.

data.chText: 她对自己的前途事业已作了精心规划。
data.enText: She has her career all planned out.

example: the plans for City Hall were on file
the awkward design of the keyboard made operation difficult
it was an excellent design for living

tr: a series of steps to be carried out or goals to be accomplished
example: they drew up a six-step plan
they discussed plans for a new bond issue
He is planning a trip with his family

tr: have the will and intention to carry out some action
example: He plans to be in graduate school next year
The rebels had planned turmoil and confusion

tr: make or work out a plan for
example: They contrived to murder their boss

tr: plan out in systematic, often graphic form
example: plan the new wing of the museum

value.def: A plan is a method of achieving something that you have worked out in detail beforehand.

example.ex: The three leaders had worked out a peace plan...
example.tran: 3位领导人已制订出了一个和平方案。

example.ex: The project is part of a United Nations plan for refugees.
example.tran: 该项目是联合国难民计划的一部分。

example.ex: ...a detailed plan of action for restructuring the group...
example.tran: 改组该集团的详细行动计划

example.ex: He maintains that everything is going according to plan.
example.tran: 他坚称一切都在按计划进行。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, also <l>according to</l> N

value.def: If you plan what you are going to do, you decide in detail what you are going to do, and you intend to do it.

example.ex: If you plan what you're going to eat, you reduce your chances of overeating...
example.tran: 如果计划一下要吃什么，就有可能不会吃得过多。

example.ex: He planned to leave Baghdad on Monday...
example.tran: 他计划周一离开巴格达。

example.ex: It would be difficult for schools to plan for the future...
I had been planning a trip to the West Coast...
example.tran: 我一直计划去趟西海岸。

example.ex: A planned demonstration has been called off by its organisers.
example.tran: 原定的游行示威已被组织者取消。

value.def: If you have plans, you are intending to do a particular thing.

example.ex: 'I'm sorry,' she said. 'I have plans for tonight.'
The government is making plans to evacuate more than two hundred of its citizens from the troubled area.
example.tran: 政府打算疏散200多名留在骚乱地区的公民。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>for</l> n/-ing, N to-inf

value.tran: （有做某一特定事的）计划，打算，意向

value.def: When you plan something that you are going to make, build, or create, you decide what the main parts of it will be and do a drawing of how it should be made.

example.ex: We are planning a new kitchen.

value.tran: 设计；绘制…的图样（或图表）

value.def: A plan of something that is going to be built or made is a detailed diagram or drawing of it.

example.ex: ...when you have drawn a plan of the garden.
example.tran: 当你画出花园的平面图后

trans: 生产计划；生产规划；编制生产计划；生产 计划；生产计划图
行动计划；行动方案；执行计划；行动规划；实施方案
教案设计；教案；教学设计；教案式；授课教案
